intro: Euphrasia arctica subsp. arctica, commonly known as the Arctic eyebright, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its small, yellow-orange flowers and hairy, dark green leaves. This species thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often found in tundra and alpine environments. It has adapted to cold climates with a short growing season and is typically found in open, well-drained habitats. The plant is part of the Scrophulariaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
